question_sentence: People magazine published snippets of Britney Spears' memoir on Tuesday, ahead of its release next week. What is the book called?
evidence: The "bombshell" memoir will share previously undisclosed information about Spears' career and personal life. In one excerpt published this week, she revealed that she had an abortion while dating fellow pop star Justin Timberlake, describing the experience as "agonising".

question_sentence: What was hung from London's Millennium Bridge this week to act as a warning to river traffic that repair work is going on?
evidence: A bale of straw has been hanging from the Millennium Bridge as repair work goes on, in accordance with the Port of London Thames Byelaws. The legislation calls for the suspension of straw by day and a white light at night to warn boats of reduced headroom.

question_sentence: A signalling error meant a train carrying members of the European Parliament from Charles de Gaulle airport outside Paris ended up where?
evidence: The special train chartered to take EU officials between the parliament's two seats in Brussels and Strasbourg took a wrong turn and ended up at Marne-la-Vallée, home of Disneyland Paris. The incident, said Politico, will do little to "deter those who deride the institution as a Mickey Mouse Parliament". Sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter for more odd news.

question_sentence: Donald Trump was attacked by what during a speech in Iowa this week?
evidence: The former US president swatted away flies during his address in Clive as he "went off on a tangent" and claimed that fly paper is illegal. "I didn't know you had flies in Iowa. I hate flies!" he exclaimed.

question_sentence: The Mexican government is reviving a 100-year-old railway line in a bid to attract container traffic. Which bodies of water will the track connect?
evidence: The $2.8bn revival of the Tehuantepec Interoceanic Corridor could divert cargo traffic from the Panama Canal and provide a new route by which international freight could travel.

question_sentence: What percentage of Australian voters submitted "No" ballots in the country's Indigenous Voice referendum last Saturday?
evidence: Australians voted by a clear majority to reject plans to give Indigenous people more political rights. Groups on both sides of the debate have called for "a period of national unity and reflection while the dust settles" following the vote. For more international news, sign up to our free Global Digest newsletter.

question_sentence: Football legend Eric Cantona performed the first concert of his singer-songwriter career last weekend. In which French city did it take place?
evidence: The former Manchester United striker, who began his football career in the Burgundy town of Auxerre, performed a two-hour set that won the critics over, with Le Parisien newspaper comparing Cantona’s music to Leonard Cohen and Nick Cave.

question_sentence: The president of which African country travelled to China this week to ask for a $1 billion loan?
evidence: President William Ruto requested the funds in order to complete "white elephant projects" in Kenya. He was also prepared to "beg for more time to settle more than $8 billion in existing loans from China", said The Times. To find out more, tune in to the latest episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: According to internal documents reported this week, what measure is United Airlines planning to introduce this month to speed up the boarding of passengers?
evidence: United Airlines believes it could shave up to two minutes off the time it takes passengers to board a plane by asking those with aisle seats to wait until window-seat passengers have boarded.

question_sentence: Which city is home to the best drinking spot anywhere, according to the latest World's 50 Best Bars list?
evidence: For the second consecutive year, Barcelona has found itself home to the No.1 bar in the world, according to the latest rankings. Cocktail bar Sips took the title from last year's winner Paradiso, which slipped to fourth place. For more Food & Drink news, sign up to our newsletter.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden made an extraordinary wartime visit this week to which country?
evidence: President Biden visited Israel in a dramatic show of support for the country as it works to eliminate Hamas, the Islamist group that controls Gaza.

question_sentence: Where will next month’s Republican presidential debate take place?
evidence: The third GOP presidential primary debate will be held on November 8 in Miami. It will be co-sponsored by the Republican Jewish Coalition, the group announced Monday. The decision comes amid the escalating violence in Israel and Gaza following the deadly attack by Hamas earlier this month.

question_sentence: Which major pharmacy chain filed for bankruptcy this week?
evidence: Rite Aid filed for bankruptcy after losing nearly $3 billion over the past six years.

question_sentence: Which popular travel destination reported a “widespread” rise in bedbugs this fall?
evidence: The French government has vowed action to “reassure and protect” the public as Paris reports a “widespread” rise in bedbugs.

question_sentence: Which pop singer released a concert film that set a record at the box office?
evidence: Taylor Swift’s concert movie brought in about $96 million, making it the highest-grossing concert film domestically for an opening weekend, according to AMC.

question_sentence: Which medication is expected to substantially increase in price in the coming months?
evidence: The price of the lifesaving Covid-19 antiviral medication Paxlovid will more than double as the US transitions out of the emergency phase of the pandemic, drugmaker Pfizer said this week.

question_sentence: Which state is investigating robotaxi collisions after a handful of incidents recently endangered pedestrians?
evidence: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and California investigators have opened a probe into whether General Motors’ self-driving vehicles are safe around pedestrians.

question_sentence: The US government is opening a public portal for Americans to report which kind of sightings?
evidence: The Pentagon is preparing for a flood of new reports as it readies two new portals for sightings of unidentified anomalous phenomena, more commonly known as UFOs.

question_sentence: According to a recent study, which nutrient-rich food was once a staple for early Europeans?
evidence: Seaweed and aquatic plants were once a staple food for ancient Europeans, according to a new analysis of dental fossils.

question_sentence: Which streaming platform announced new price increases this week for millions of users?
evidence: Netflix has raised its prices again. The company’s stock surged following the price hikes and an announcement that the company saw a boost of over 8 million subscribers last quarter.

question_sentence: What subject does Cory Hafer, the 2024 Delaware Teacher of the Year, teach at Middletown High School?
Why is Fort Delaware known to be such an eerie place according to Daryl Marston from "Ghost Hunters"?
Which two Rite Aid stores in Delaware are slated to close due to the company's Chapter 11 bankruptcy?
What is the specialty drink at the Rail Haus German-style beer garden in Dover, Delaware?
How much was spent on legal services by Delaware schools in the last fiscal year, from October 1 to September 30?
When does daylight saving time officially end in 2023?

Former Smyrna detective Michael Kealty is facing federal charges for distributing and possessing child pornography. What potential penalties could he face if convicted of distributing child pornography?
Why has Wilmington resisted reducing parking ticket costs?
What is the main reason for Wilmington Mayor Mike Purzycki's proposal to eliminate the residency requirement for city employees?
Who is the Republican candidate seeking the nomination for Delaware's at-large U.S. House of Representatives seat in the upcoming election?
